III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff has made sexual comments to female child about what she
is wearing, her body figure and shape. She sits very close to Staff
at the desk. Staff A touches and rubs her legs. Two staff engage
in physical and sexual activity at the facility. This has been
observed by the female child.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was attempted to be interviewed via phone on
July 17, 2024, and July 26, 2024. Consultant left a voicemail for
the complainant on July 17, 2024, and could not get through on
July 26, 2024.
Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were separately
interviewed face to face at the facility on July 18, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A, Youth B, Youth C,
and Youth D all reported they feel safe at the facility, and no staff
there have made them feel uncomfortable or said sexual
comments to them. Youth A is not aware of who Staff 1 or Staff 2
is. Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were aware of Staff 1 and Staff
2 and noted no concerns with them. They reported they enjoy it
when Staff 1 works because she will check in with the youth
individually. Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D reported Staff 2 works
overnight shifts so they have limited interactions with him and
noted no concerns. Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D
reported they had never seen or heard about two staff members
being inappropriate with one another at the facility. All youth
reported the staff are professional with one another and they are
not aware if there are any staff in relationships with one another.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 18,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported
she has been working at the facility for almost five months now
and enjoys her job. She reported she has been embarrassed that
her ex-boyfriend had been calling up to the facility trying to get
information about Staff 1 from other workers. Staff 1 denied ever
having a sexual relationship with Staff 2 at work or outside of
work. Staff 1 reported she has never seen or heard of Staff 2
2

being inappropriate or sexually inappropriate with any of the
youth. She has good relationships with the youth, and they have
never disclosed anything about Staff 2 to her.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on July 31, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported he has
been working at the facility for a couple of months and works
overnight shifts, noting it is 11:30pm-7:30am. He reported he does
not work with Staff 1 as she works the second shift. Staff 2
reported he has never had a physical or sexual relationship at the
facility with any staff or youth. He reported that is prohibited at the
facility. Staff 2 denied having any boundary issues with the youth
at the facility and noted they are sleeping during his shift. He
reported if a youth does wake up during his shift, he is never alone
one-on-one with the youth. Staff 2 reported he has never made
sexual comments to any of the youth at the facility. He reported he
is trained at the facility to maintain appropriate boundaries with the
youth and always remain professional.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 18,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he
has worked with both Staff 1 and Staff 2 and noted no concerns
with their professionalism. He reported the youth trust Staff 1.
Staff 3 reported Staff 2 works the overnight shift and has positive
interactions with the youth. He reported he has never seen or
heard concerns of Staff 2 being inappropriate or sexual with the
youth. Staff 3 reported he has not heard of Staff 1 and Staff 2
being in a relationship or having any sexual relations at the facility.
Documents Reviewed:
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- Staff 1 has no disciplinary
actions noted with her HR file and is up to date on all her
trainings. On April 17, 2024, Staff 1 completed training that
reviewed the professional boundary policies.
- Staff 2’s Human Resource File- Staff 2 has no disciplinary
actions noted with his HR file and is up to date on all his
trainings. On June 7, 2024, Staff 2 completed training that
reviewed the professional boundary policies.
- Facility’s Policy on Staff and Client Interaction Policy
approval date January 2023- Policy notes all staff should
conduct themselves in a professional and appropriate
manner when interacting with the youth at the facility. The
policy notes that staff member should never present
3

themselves in a manner that could be construed as
flirtatious or sexual in nature to clients.
- Facility’s Policy on Employee Behavior Policy approval
date May 2021- This policy notes that staff are not allowed
to partake in immoral, violent or incident conduct on the
facility’s property.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as all youth interviewed denied
any concerns of Staff 1 or Staff 2 being sexually inappropriate with
them and Staff 1 and Staff 2 deny having inappropriate contact at
the facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
